DOCTOR WHO: (F/X DRAWN-OUT MATERIALISATION SOUNDS — THE TARDIS DOESN’T WANT TO LAND)
FLIP: Anarkali! Anarkali! How do I stop telling Scavenger stuff about the TARDIS?
ANARKALT: You cannot. It is part of the absorption process. Yes... I sense Scavenger failed to take the ‘TARDIS’ before, but now it knows more.
FLIP: What do I know? I don’t know anything about how it works!
ANARKALT: More than that, even. Everything it knows of the Earth is of the Earth as it was in my time. But you, you know everything about the Earth in the present day.
FLIP: Yeah, it might come a bit unstuck with that.
ANARKALI: That is what it wants. Tactical information.
FLIP: I promise you I wouldn’t know a tactic if I ate one.
ANARKALT: Wait. I can see someone in your mind. Who is this man? So important to you. (BEAT) You travel with your own physician?
FLIP: And now I can see someone in yours. That’s Salim? You got yourself a hot royal?
ANARKALT: We are linked. We are exchanging knowledge.
FLIP: Weirdest girly chat I’ve ever had. —
TARDIS: scavenge... aborted.
FLIP: Doctor! Don’t go!
DOCTOR WHO: SCAVENGER by William Gallagher (003-NB edit) Page 120
ANARKALT: Scavenger... gave up. Why did Scavenger give up? — Yes. Yes, I know why.
SCAVENGER: Identification: Salvage 2. Programming absorbed. Hull defences neutralised. Disengaging.
FLIP: What-?
ANARKALT: Hold on, Flip. Scavenger is about to break out!
ANARKALT: (F/X BANG! SCAVENGER BLASTS OUT OF SALVAGE 2 AND INTO FLIGHT IN THE UPPER ATMOSPHERE, HEADING FOR ORBIT.)
DOCTOR WHO: SCAVENGER by William Gallagher (FINAL) Page 121
DOCTOR WHO: SCENE 93. EXT. ISRA — SPACE CENTRE BUILDING
DOCTOR WHO: (IT’S THE SAME EXTERIOR AS BEFORE BUT THE HOARDS OF REPORTERS AND PRESS ARE A LITTLE WAY OFF. WE’RE WITH SALIM AND JUST ONE
OF THEM: OUR TV REPORTER FROM BEFORE. )
SALIM: Thanks for seeing me, Ms Fletcher.
MELISSA: [TV REPORTER] : Can’t say I’m not intrigued. An exclusive, you said?
SALIM: So long as you understand, you didn’t get this from me.
MELISSA: [TV REPORTER] : Get what?
SALIM: Everything that goes on inside Mission Control is recorded, that’s just standard. That’s how I acquired this:
SALIM: [..] long as I say nothing about you having the power cut to mission control, right at the start of the mission?
JESSICA: Prove it, big man.
SALIM: Suddenly the whole complex loses power and you arrive. It doesn’t take a genius.
JESSICA: What can I say? I arrange a little power cut, Salvage 2 goes off course, Britain saves the day. It was all in the contract, Slim.
SALIM: Is that enough to give you a story?
MELISSA: [TV REPORTER]: Broadcast quality, too.
DOCTOR WHO: SCAVENGER by William Gallagher (003-NB edit) Page 122
DOCTOR WHO: SCENE 94. INT. MANDELA — BRIDGE
JYOTI: (INTO MIC) Flip, Doctor, are you okay? Scope’s showing multiple targets, it’s like you’ve exploded. You haven’t exploded, have you?
FLIP: (OVER SPEAKERS) Feels like it!
DOCTOR WHO: SCAVENGER by William Gallagher (FINAL) Page 123
DOCTOR WHO: SCENE 95. INT. ISRA — MISSION CONTROL
JESSICA: (CALLING) Security! Salim! Anyone! (TO HERSELF) I need minions.
JESSICA: He’1ll do. (FX: DOOR OPENS) Doctor, what have you done to Scavenger?
DOCTOR: Is it still there? Good.
JESSICA: Looks like you blew it apart.
DOCTOR: No, that’s Salvage 2.
SALIM: Doctor? What did you do? I had Salvage 2 twenty minutes from landing!
DOCTOR: It wasn’t me. Scavenger has broken out of Salvage 2.
JESSICA: You can see the debris trail. Built to clean up space junk, but that’s what it’s become. Ironic.
DOCTOR: That’s not the problem, Ms Allaway. I’m very much afraid that Salvage 2 will have told Scavenger everything it knows. Course programmes, algorithms; anything it can use.
SALIM: So, what? It’s coming here?
SCAVENGER: (OVER SPEAKERS) Processing: Salvage 2 Software Program. Program absorbed. Weapons ready.
DOCTOR WHO: SCAVENGER by William Gallagher (003-NB edit) Page 124
DOCTOR WHO: SCENE 97. INT. SCAVENGER
DOCTOR WHO: (VERY NOISY: IT’S STILL IN ATMOSPHERE. FLIP STILL BEING
BATTERED: ABOUT. ANARKALI STILL PERFECTLY QUIET AND CALM. UNAFFECTED. )
ANARKALT: This is new. I sense Scavenger wants to... salvage things? It wants to Clean Up Space?
FLIP: Cleaning up sounds good.
SCAVENGERS: Weapons ranging.
FLIP: Ranging on [what?]
FLIP: (SUDDEN ACCELERATION PRESSES AGAINST FLIP. SHE STRUGGLES TO FINISH THE SENTENCE)
FLIP: Whoa! Scavenger, slow down! Slow down!!!
DOCTOR WHO: SCAVENGER by William Gallagher (FINAL) Page 125
DOCTOR WHO: SCENE 98. INT. ISRA — MISSION CONTROL
SALIM: It’s whipped right around the Earth and is flying over Pakistan. Wait, now crossing into Rjasthan. So fast!
DOCTOR: How can it get that speed in low Earth orbit?
SALIM: It’s not risen above the ionosphere. It’s achieving that speed in atmosphere.
JESSICA: Compare tech specs later, would you? It’s slowing down.
DOCTOR: And heading for —
DOCTOR: DOCTOR/SALIM: (SIMULTANEOUSLY) New Delhi.
DOCTOR: Why there? It’s a lovely city but why there? Why now?
SALIM: A lot of the flight software was written in New Delhi. Does it know that? How could it know that?
DOCTOR: It knows everything Salvage 2 knows.
DOCTOR WHO: SCAVENGER by William Gallagher (003-NB edit) Page 126
DOCTOR WHO: SCENE 99. INT. SCAVENGER
FLIP: Oh, I can breathe again. (HEAVES) Where are we?
ANARKALT: Hastinapur.
SCAVENGER: New program. Clean Up Earth begins. Cycling weapon emitters. Firing.
FLIP: Scavenger, no!!!
FLIP: (F/X FROM INSIDE — SCAVENGER BEGINS FIRING LASERS DOWN ON NEW
DELHI. CROSS TO: )
DOCTOR WHO: SCAVENGER by William Gallagher (FINAL) Page 127
DOCTOR WHO: SCENE 100. INT. ISRA — MISSION CONTROL
JESSICA: It’s all over the citizen news networks, see?
SALIM: What’s it doing?
JESSICA: Firing on New Delhi, obviously. (BEAT) That is some technology.
DOCTOR: What it’s doing is cleaning up Earth.
SALIM: Cleaning up Earth-?!
DOCTOR: Scavenger seems to have got its wires crossed. Right now, it sees humankind as — well, junk. (INTO MIC) Scavenger, this is the Doctor. Your program is in error. Shut down and stand by for further instructions. Repeat, shut down and stand by for [further instructions. ]
JESSICA: It’s not listening, Doctor. (INTO PHONE) Jessica Allaway, authority niner-niner-seven. Get me missile command right now.
DOCTOR: Ms Allaway, please! I’1l think of something!!!
JESSICA: I don’t see what. Tell me you really think this ‘Flip’ person is more important than the lives of everyone in New Delhi? (INTO PHONE) Missile Command, this is your second authorisation. No countermands. Launch when ready.
DOCTOR WHO: SCAVENGER by William Gallagher (003-NB edit) Page 128
DOCTOR WHO: SCENE 101. INT. SCAVENGER
FLIP: Scavenger! Cease firing!
FLIP: Nothing. Nothing.
ANARKALT: Scavenger, this is your host. Stop.
SCAVENGER: Identification: Anarkali.
FLIP: Great, it’s listening to you.
SCAVENGER: Identification: host replaced. Host updated. Purging previous host.
FLIP: No! Scavenger! I’m your new host, listen to me. Tactical advantage to keeping Anarkali! She’s — it’s — she’s — she — she knows Salim! She knows people on Earth right now.
SCAVENGER: Purge cancelled.
ANARKALT: Thank you. You saved me.
FLIP: Yeah, well, hurry up and help me think of a tactical reason to make Scavenger stop firing! — I seriously need some tactics.
DOCTOR WHO: SCAVENGER by William Gallagher (FINAL) Page 129
DOCTOR WHO: SCENE 102. INT. ISRA — MISSION CONTROL
JESSICA: Well, Spaceguard is useful, isn’t it, Doctor? Look. I’d say that’s a full-strike complement of missiles. In the air. Unstoppable.
SCAVENGER: (OVER SPEAKER) Incoming targets.
FLIP: (OVER SPEAKER) Doctor? Doctor, help me! Help me think of a reason to make it stop!
DOCTOR: (INTO MIC) I can’t. Flip, I need you to think of somewhere far away. Of a journey you’d like to make.
FLIP: (OVER SPEAKER) What-?
SCAVENGER: (OVER SPEAKER) Missiles ranged and focused.
FLIP: (OVER SPEAKER) Missiles-?! Scavenger doesn’t have m—
DOCTOR: Please, Flip. Close your eyes. Focus.
SALIM: Contact in twenty seconds.
FLIP: (OVER SPEAKER) I get it. The missiles aren’t Scavenger’s. They’re coming at Scavenger, aren’t they? They’re shooting Scavenger down, and me with it!
DOCTOR: I mean it, Flip. Think of somewhere far away. It won’t hurt if you think of some place far away.
JESSICA: “Some place far away.” It’s what they say to prisoners facing execution, isn’t it? They say it helps.
SALIM: Ten seconds to impact. Nine. Eight. Seven. Six. Five. Four. —
DOCTOR WHO: SCAVENGER by William Gallagher (003-NB edit) Page 130
FLIP: (OVER SPEAKER) I’ve been everywhere, Doctor. You’ve taken me everywhere I wanted to go. It’s been brilliant.
DOCTOR: Not quite everywhere. Think, Flip, think!
SALIM: Three. Two. One.
JESSICA: Look. TV’s reporting a fireball over New Delhi.
DOCTOR: She’s gone.
DOCTOR: END OF PART THREE
DOCTOR WHO: SCAVENGER by William Gallagher (FINAL) Page 131

elements.text: PART FOUR
Ten seconds to impact. Nine. Eight. Seven. Six. Five. Four. —
SIMULTANEOUSLY, TO END ON SALIM’S ‘FOUR’:
(OVER SPEAKER) I’ve been everywhere, Doctor. You’ve taken me
everywhere I wanted to go. It’s been brilliant.
Not quite everywhere. Think, Flip, think!
Three. Two. One.
F/X COMMS BUZZ FROM SCAVENGER CUTS OUT
BEAT
Look. TV’s reporting a fireball over New Delhi.
She’s gone.
CONTINUES INTO:
SCENE 103. INT. ISRA — MISSION CONTROL [CONTINUED]
(HUSHED) Anarkali. My whole life. All this long, long life, devoted to getting you back and now —
Your faces. I just saved a city, I’m having a great day.
That’s enough, Ms Allaway. Please — be quiet.
F/X FUZZ, FLICKERING FROM SPEAKERS. SUDDENLY:
(OVER SPEAKERS) [Going] so fast! Slow down! Slow down!!!
But that’s — that’s impossible!
SCAVENGER by William Gallagher (003-NB edit) Page 132
Thank goodness.
Scavenger’s not there. It’s gone!
Gone, yes. Scavenger took off for its next destination before Flip had even finished thinking where it was she wanted to go.
What-?

Flip is becoming part of Scavenger. Its host. I gambled that Flip’s desire to be elsewhere would override Scavenger’s desire to clean up Earth. For now, it seems I was right. (INTO MIC) Flip? Flip, can you hear me?
(F/X YOU KNOW THOSE SCI-FI FILMS THAT SHOW ACCELERATION BY BLASTING THE HEROES’ FACES WITH WIND SO MUCH THAT THEIR SKIN RIPPLES? THAT’S WHAT IS HAPPENING TO FLIP.)
(OVER SPEAKER) CAN’T — CAN’/T TALK!
And yet she does.
(INTO MIC) We’re going to try to get a fix on you. Just hold on a little while longer.
Doctor — does this mean Anarkali has cheated death, too?
Salim — I’m sorry, but Anarkali cannot still be alive. She has to have died hundreds of years ago. Flip is alone up there. Physically, at least.
If Salim here really is as old as he says, if Scavenger’s beam did that to him — well, why can’t his girlfriend be alive?
Now she believes. Doctor?
SCAVENGER by William Gallagher (FINAL) Page 133

Salim, you and Anarkali were probed by the same beam and your ageing was stalled. But that has to have been a byproduct. Scavenger needs hosts and it protects them, it goes to huge lengths to protect them, but only for as long as it takes to absorb them into its workings. One hour, that’s what it said.
I feel ill.
Anarkali’s mind was scavenged and then it let her body die. Starved to death.
Scavenger was in orbit, I daresay Anarkali would have died from oxygen starvation first. It would have been quick.
Died between those two walls.
I’m sorry. But that’s what’s going to happen to Flip, as soon as her absorption is complete. And we’ve got less than an hour to stop it.
Then — then we must do what we can to bring her home.
F/X TRACKING NOISES
Got to catch her first.
Is that Scavenger’s trail?
It’s changing course like mad. It was heading for the Azores a minute ago, then Malta. Now it looks like... Crete?
Your friend was thinking of all those places at once?
No. Only one.
SCAVENGER by William Gallagher (003-NB edit) Page 134
SCENE 104. INT. SCAVENGER
ACCELERATION SLOWING
At last. Slowing down.
THE ACCELERATION STOPS
(OVER SPEAKER) Flip? Flip, can you hear me?
Just about. Still wedged, by the way. Any time you want to rescue me from wherever we’ve got to...
(OVER SPEAKER) Exactly where you thought of. Exactly where you told me where you wanted to visit, all that time ago, back on Tranquillity...?
Atlantis? Seriously?
F/X CROSS TO:
SCAVENGER by William Gallagher (FINAL) Page 135
SCENE 105. INT. ISRA — MISSION CONTROL [CONTINUOUS]
(SCORNFUL) Atlantis!
Where in the world is Atlantis?
Atlantis is... complicated. There are several possible places it might be. It looks like Scavenger’s trying them all.
At least it won’t be ‘cleaning up’ any more cities, while it’s trying to make up its mind.
Precisely. (INTO MIC) Scavenger, report status.

(IN SCAVENGER-LIKE VOICE) Did you do that... Doctor? Did you rescue me from inbound targets, full-strike spread, no compass gap, no altitude gap, ranged and bearing, brace for impact, launch log and —
F/X CROSS BACK TO:
SCAVENGER by William Gallagher (003-NB edit) Page 136
SCENE 106. INT. SCAVENGER [CONTINUOUS ]
(BACK TO HER OWN VOICE) Doctor, it’s using my voice! Doctor!
Scavenger is absorbing you. You are absorbing Scavenger.
(OVER SPEAKER) I’m afraid you and Scavenger are merging.
That’s what she just said.
(OVER SPEAKER) Sorry? I didn’t hear anyone.
SCAVENGER by William Gallagher (FINAL) Page 137
SCENE 107. INT. ISRA — MISSION CONTROL [CONTINUOUS]
Doctor, she doesn’t believe she’s alone up there.
F/X BUZZ/FIZZ STATIC
(OVER SPEAKER) Doctor? Doctor, it’s Jyoti onboard the Mandela.
Hold on, Flip. Important message coming through.
F/X CROSS TO:
SCAVENGER by William Gallagher (003-NB edit) Page 138
SCENE 108. INT. MANDELA — BRIDGE [CONTINUOUS]
Doctor, the Mandela’s coming off alert and the crew’s going to be returning to the bridge soon. I can’t stay for much longer.
(OVER SPEAKER) Quickly, then. Let’s take stock of our assets. Is anything docked with the Mandela right now?
F/X KEYBOARDS AND BLEEPS
Nothing. Well, two food supply drones.
(OVER SPEAKER) Can you fly them?
I said, they’re empty drones, no pilots.
(OVER SPEAKER) Yes, but can you fly them?
I can control them remotely from the Mandela, yes.
F/X CROSS BACK TO:
SCAVENGER by William Gallagher (FINAL) Page 139
SCENE 109. INT. ISRA — MISSION CONTROL [CONTINUOUS ]
Check their status, Jyoti. Fuel capacity, maximum speeds, the lot.
(OVER SPEAKER) Okay, hold on, I’1ll be —
F/X CUT OFF BY FLIP COMING BACK IN
(OVER SPEAKER) [1I’11] just talk to myself, shall I? Sorry, Anarkali, I know you’re here too.
What did she say-?
(OVER SPEAKER) I mean, who’s so important? Doctor?
(INTO MIC) Flip, do you remember the name of the astronaut you saved on the Mandela?
(OVER SPEAKER) Course I do! — Oh, I get it. This is like, ‘what day is it, who’s the Prime Minister’?
Something like that, yes.
(OVER SPEAKER) Jyoti. Jyoti Cutler. And my useless boyf, his name’s Jared, and my even more useless little brother, he’s Philip. Satisfied?
Philip? That’s.. interesting.
(OVER SPEAKER) Philippa and Philip, yeah. Do you think they wanted a boy much?
I can’t take this. (INTO MIC) Flip, put Anarkali on.
(OVER SPEAKER, CALLING) Yeah, alright. Anarkali? Anarkali, the Prince here wants to talk to you!
BEAT
SCAVENGER by William Gallagher (003-NB edit) Page 140
I can’t hear anything. Why can’t I hear anything?
(WHISPER, ASIDE) I told you, Salim — Anarkali was absorbed centuries ago. She’s speaking in Flip’s head because Flip is also being absorbed.
She is — in Flip...?
(WHISPER, ASIDE) Inside the host. Best if we don’t let on for now.
(OVER SPEAKER) Alright, you two, we'll get you a room soon enough. Happy now, your highness?
(LYING) Yes. Thank you, Flip.
F/X SCAVENGER ENGINES SLOWING THROUGH
(OVER SPEAKER) No worries. — Hold up, Scavenger’s slowing.
Wherever we are, I think we’ve arrived.
F/X CROSS BACK TO:
SCAVENGER by William Gallagher (FINAL) Page 141
110. INT. SCAVENGER [CONTINUOUS]
(OVER SPEAKER) Scavenger, report status please.

(AS SCAVENGER) Identification: Atlantis. (BEAT) Correction. Identification not possible. (AS HERSELF) I could’ve told you that. There’s no such place, I just remember it from a TV show. (BEAT) No, I don’t know anything more than that. (BEAT) It’s like talking to yourself. Anarkali, how do you stand it? ...
F/X CROSS BACK TO:
SCAVENGER by William Gallagher (003-NB edit) Page 142
SCENE 111. INT. ISRA — MISSION CONTROL [CONTINUOUS]
(OVER SPEAKER) .. Anarkali?
(INTO MIC) Stand by, Flip. (F/X SWITCHES MIC OFF) Jessica, Salim. Scavenger has come to a halt right where it thinks Atlantis was.
The Canary Islands?
Yes. Completely wrong, of course, but that’s not important now. (INTO MIC) Jyoti? Are you there, Jyoti?
(OVER SPEAKER) Still here, Doctor.
(INTO MIC) Tell me about those drones aboard the Mandela.
(OVER SPEAKER) They’re both about fifty percent fuelled. Typical re-entry path takes four orbits, so we could get them to Scavenger if you need.
(INTO MIC) Then they’1l do.
Why? What are you planning, Doctor?
I can’t land aboard Scavenger in my TARDIS, not without the risk of Scavenger scavenging its technology. I can’t give away the TARDIS’s secrets so easily.
Pity.
So you’re going to save Flip, how?

By putting herself in my place. I flatter myself that Scavenger will view me as a rather more tempting host. I fly to Scavenger in the first drone, allow myself to be scavenged, release Flip into the second drone... and have Jyoti fly her back to the Mandela.
SCAVENGER by William Gallagher (FINAL) Page 143
Even if your plan works, that won’t stop Scavenger.
My mind won’t be quite so easily absorbed, I hope. If it comes to a battle of wills between me and that machine, I might be able to batter it into submission.
‘Might’!

It’s a risk, I admit, but it’s the best I have to offer against the certainty that very soon, Scavenger will complete its absorption of Flip and set about cleaning up Earth again. (INTO MIC) Jyoti? Are you still there?
(OVER SPEAKER) Still here, Doctor.
Get those drones ready to launch. I’1ll be at the Mandela supply bay in just a few moments.
Can’t meet you there, I’m afraid. I’ve had to barricade the flight crew out of the bridge.
What?
Yeah, I don’t think the Commander’s at all happy about it.
No matter, so long as you can fly those drones. I’m on my way. In the meantime, my friend Salim will fill you in on the plan.
(OVER SPEAKER) Hurry up, then. (BEAT) The Commander’s trying to cut through the bulkhead, I think.
(GETTING UP) Salim, Ms Allaway. Try to behave yourselves in my absence. (WALKING TO TARDIS) I’1l be back later.
No, you won’t.
(F/X OPENING THE TARDIS DOOR) Do you know, people usually believe me when I say that?
SCAVENGER by William Gallagher (003-NB edit) Page 144
Go, Doctor. Do what you can for your friend.
F/X TARDIS DOOR CLOSES. DEMATERIALISES.
If he does come back, I am having that box of his.
(INTO MIC) Jyoti? Miss Cutler? The plan is this —
(OVER SPEAKER) This isn’t Jyoti Cutler. This is Gabbard, on the Mandela.
Commander Gabbard?
(OFF, OVER SPEAKER) I’m sorry-!
Miss Cutler is relieved of duty, pending an investigation into her actions in the aftermath of the collision earlier today. The collision caused by your ‘Clean Up Space’ mission — Mister Jahangir!
I can explain everything —
Explain it to the inquiry. Mandela out.
F/X LINE DEAD
There goes the Doctor’s plan.
Then we shall have to think of an alternative.
SCAVENGER by William Gallagher (FINAL) Page 145
SCENE 112. INT. SCAVENGER
(WEAKENING) Doctor... please, hurry...
You are nearly absorbed. It was at this point that I wrote my message for Salim.
I’m not writing anything in blood, thank you very much. The Doctor’s on his way. The Doctor’1ll fix it. I know he will. I just wish he’d hurry up about it.
Don’t be afraid.
I’m not — okay, you already know, of course you already know. I’m a little scared. Okay?
It will not hurt. Scavenger repairs as it replaces.
How does that work, then?
Feel your arm, Flip. Is it still broken?
Course it is, it can’t just mend — hang about. It’s alright, it’s fixed. My arm’s alright!
Just as your strange suit has been repaired, and the bottled air you brought has been replenished.
Sixty minutes on the oxygen counter. How’d it do that, without my noticing?
Just as your mind is becoming part of Scavenger, so your body is becoming part of Scavenger, too.
So Scavenger thinks my spacesuit is part of me — that’s why it’s fixed it, right?
SCAVENGER by William Gallagher (003-NB edit) Page 146
Scavenger needs you in perfect condition, to be perfectly absorbed.
(SOTTO) Big mistake, Scavenger. Big, big mistake!
What are you thinking, Flip? Scavenger wants to know.
If my mind is in Scavenger’s, Scavenger can see for itself, can’t it?
Scavenger sees... ice. It feels... cold. It sees you alone, flying above a frozen lake on a.. “micro-lite”? Is this is a memory of yours?
No kidding.
It sees you with someone called... Dare? You at the controls of technological device called a... a “tele-port”!
I’m seeing you now, in Lahore, all those years ago. The pink beam that took you away, remember? That’s how Scavenger brought us here, me and you both. By teleport!
You know what “teleport” is?
Do I ever. That’s how I got here.. and that’s how I’m getting off!
SCAVENGER by William Gallagher (FINAL) Page 147
SCENE 113. INT. ISRA — MISSION CONTROL
F/X SHOWER OF SPARKS
There, that’s freed it.
The flight computer for Salvage 2? What d’you need that for?
Never you mind.
Oh, I get it. You think destroying that’s going to help bury the evidence of your sabotage? I’ve got news for you, Salim —
Everything’s backed up remotely, I know. And I’m not destroying at.
Well, what exactly are you doing with it, then?
F/X TARDIS MATERIALISING, JUST OFF. DOOR OPENS
Well, that didn’t go according to plan.
Doctor! Did you not get the welcome you were hoping for aboard the Mandela?
Two surprisingly burly astronauts tried to arrest me when I landed in the supply drone bay.
What, so you ran away?
Discretion is sometimes the better part of valour, Ms Allaway. More to the point, I wouldn’t exactly have been in a position to enact Plan B — would I now?
You’re just making it up as you go along!
All will become clear. Salim — what are you doing, disconnecting that flight computer?
SCAVENGER by William Gallagher (003-NB edit) Page 148
Just salvaging what I can from Salvage 2.
Oh, really? Because for a moment there I thought you might have been hoping to tempt Scavenger into some sort of exchange.
What do you mean, ‘exchange’?
Scavenger grabbed both Flip and Anarkali by means of what I can only describe as a teleport beam. It finds itself a suitable host, then teleports them aboard in order to absorb them.
So?
So the Doctor and I are about to argue over which of us will offer ourselves up as an alternative host, in exchange for PLip:
I believe that Salim intends to take the flight computer with him. A piece of high technology to offer as some kind of sweetener?
Oh, a bribe! Fair enough, I get that.
I’m afraid, Salim, that it’s a very meagre offering, compared to the contents of a Time Lord’s brain.
Let me, Doctor. Anarkali was absorbed. If I am too, it will be a kind of being together.
Scavenger rejected you once before, remember?
I got over my cough five centuries ago. It will take me.

And I woke up Scavenger. Unintentionally, I admit, and only because you, my friend, set the process in motion. But nonetheless, this is my responsibility. (INTO MIC) Doctor to Scavenger. Status update, please.
F/X CROSS TO:
SCAVENGER by William Gallagher (FINAL) Page 149
SCENE 114. INT. SCAVENGER [CONTINUOUS]
Doctor! You’re back! Just hold on, I’m busy —
(OVER SPEAKER) Busy doing what?
Just poking around Scavenger with my mind. Looking for the teleport controls. (SOTTO) Don’t tell Scavenger, but I’m hoping I can find a way to beam myself right out of here.
(OVER SPEAKER) No, I don’t think that’s a good idea.
It’s alright, Scavenger knows what I’m doing. But it’s absorbed so much of me, there’s not a lot it can do about it.
(OVER SPEAKER) Sever the mental link between yourself and Scavenger too abruptly, and you could cause terrible damage to your mind.
Then I’1l fit right back in, back on the checkout at Freshgoods, won’t I?
(OVER SPEAKER) Freshgoods? Who’s talking about Freshgoods?
Doctor, please! I’m trying to concentrate!
Tell him you’ve reached the — you’re calling it a hard disk? So many new words. New ideas.
Not sure I’m doing it right, though. I put a bigger drive in my PC once. Wished I hadn’t started. It was all drivers and jumpers and throwing salt over my shoulder —
Identification: Jared.
Alright, it was Jared did it. But I bought the drive. Blimey, you can tell Scavenger’s a man, can’t you?
SCAVENGER by William Gallagher (003-NB edit) Page 150
Computers sound wonderful. I expect a slave girl like me would never have had one.

You’d have had a smartphone with a computer in it. It would be tiny and very fashionable. (BEAT) I’ve found something. So strange to be poking about with my mind and finding things. But I think this is a kind of app store.
Security. Owner authentication required.
I don’t know what that means.
